intro: Aetopteron californicum, commonly known as the California velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open woodlands and grasslands. It has a short lifespan and completes its life cycle within a single growing season. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across its native range.
